modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes that the hearer has the inherent power (Pouvoir) but lacks the knowledge (Savoir) and the obligation (Devoir). It is a 'Recruitment' sermon.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (False Piety) to S2 (Tragedy) to S1 (Justice) as the condition for ~S2 (Healing).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is conditional: 'Then' (v8) occurs only after the human subject performs the fast.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a social consequence of bad choices, not a cosmic state of death requiring divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is structurally anthropocentric. God is the Sender of the mandate and the Rewarder of the performance, but the Hearer is the Subject of all transformative action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: “Then,” when you have done true religion, light will come... Then, and not before.
When these become the center of policy, the city becomes both pro-God and pro-life.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God of the Bible so wants human community to work

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Jewish exiles are used as a negative example of what happens when we forget, and a positive model for what we must 'learn'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who breaks the yoke that the people are too weak to break themselves.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Burden of responsibility; potential for self-righteousness or despair depending on success.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where the human 'fast' is the efficient cause of the divine 'light'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a social-ethical manifesto, but theologically incoherent regarding the Gospel of grace.
spanning_punten: The use of 'Easter' as a metaphor for civic renewal rather than divine resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The fast of humanness is the condition of Easter.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer is already competent if they simply choose to be.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'forgetting' or 'bad religion' rather than an ontological bondage.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law' sermon without 'Gospel'. The human is the Subject; God is the Spectator/Rewarder.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told to 'loose the bonds' as if they have the power to do so.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God is the one who looses the bonds, which then enables the community to share bread.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because God has loosed your bonds of injustice, you are now free to share your bread.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero who saves the city.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the one wearing the 'yoke' who needs God to break it.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit empowers the 'fast' that is otherwise impossible for the greedy heart.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Greed as a 'Power' that holds the heart captive.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just a mistake, we don't need a Savior, just a teacher.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics is the condition for God's presence.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God's presence is the ground for Ethics.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and socially urgent, but it risks crushing the hearer under a new law by making God's 'Here I am' conditional upon human social performance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a prophetic call to action; semiotically, it is a legalistic contract.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the 'if/then' in Isaiah, but semiotics exposes that the sermon fails to provide the 'Pouvoir' (power) promised in the New Covenant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'God' is a passive actant in this text, serving only as a 'Sender' of values and a 'Receiver' of the human fast.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Easter' as a reward for good behavior rather than the source of new life.
